page.title: 18SHIPTON CEMENT WORKS
page.content: The limestone is taken out of the ground by 2 bucket diggers, 3 dumper trucks, and a conveyor belt after blasting with ammonium nitrate explosives, inserted by a mobile drill. The clay and limestone are crushed and watered to form a paste which is mixed together in a 4,000 ton slurry tank. The mixture is then poured into a 200 foot rotating kiln where it is dried by the 12 foot gas flame which heats the kiln to 2,160 degrees centigrade. Two feet of firebrick insulate the kiln. The steam is sent up the chimney which is a local landmark. The dried cement is mixed with gypsum in a ball mill containing 80 ton balls. It is then taken to one of the 62,000 ton silos or to a barn which can hold 10,000 tons. It is then loaded on to lorries or sent out by train. A new 12,000,000 pound factory is planned.
